channel.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
channel.description:
They say the main plot of new Metal gear will take place some time after MGS 4. But i don´t get it. Didn´t Raiden quit fighting and live a normal life at the end of MGS 4? And on top of that, how did he actually get back his old cyber-body? He had already got new cyber-body with light skin! Any suggestions?
Here´s the Raiden´s ending in MGS 4 [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pZfe9CdZfEE&feature=related[/url]

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Warning: The spoilertext contains spoilers for MGS2 and MGS4.

The one thing that really irks me about this game’s existence is that it undermines the entire point of Metal Gear Solid 2 in the first place. [color=black] After all, at the end of the game after Raiden kills Solidus, he tosses away the nametags inscribed with the player’s birthdate, name, and details. Considering the deconstructive nature of the story with regards to video games, this was supposed to represent Raiden refusing to be controlled by the player or anyone else anymore.Thus, with the new game, this entire point is undermined because [color=black] Raiden is once again player-controlled.

Then again, I suppose if [color=black] a similar story point is made here, namely if the game is supposed to deconstruct the Devil May Cry game design and make us feel like bastards for cutting people into tiny little chunks, then it could potentially work. Besides, when it comes to Kojima Productions, the trailers they cut together are often deliberately misleading. Remember the trailers for MGS4 where they [color=black] copy-pasted some of the real time cutscenes for Raiden into the Middle East, rather than where the sequence actually takes place in South America?

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
I really don’t think that effects much.

If you make a new Splinter cell that says fast paced run&gun action, people will still expect stealth because that’s what the IP is established as.

Besides, MGS had a lot of action too if you chose to not be stealthy, people probably assumed it was a “when you fight” type of thing.

My real problem isn’t the lack of stealth though, more the fact that the game (from the trailer) seems to betray the mood of typical Metal Gear games. Also, Raiden’s voice actor still sucks at acting.

Read full topic
